div.p:
The following communication was resolved upon at a
special meeting of the Colonial Society, convened to con-
gratulate that distinguished philosopher, the Baron von Hum-
boldt, upon his arrival in England, and to elect him an
honorary member of the society:—

body.p:
“Sir,—The committee of the Colonial Society, in con-
formity with a resolution unanimously adopted this day, beg
leave to express their gratification at your visit to this country
in the suite of your distinguished Sovereign.

“Identified as the Colonial Society is with the extension
of civilisation and the development of the internal resources
of distant and imperfectly known foreign regions, the society
gladly avails itself of the present opportunity to tender its
respectful congratulations to a philosopher, whose invaluable
services in the cause of geographical discovery and humanity
are acknowledged and justly appreciated by all civilised na-
tions, for they have had for their special object the welfare
and advancement of mankind.

“Understanding that your sojourn in England is neces-
sarily brief, the society is obliged to refrain from tendering
at present any other mark of their sincere esteem than that
of naming you an honorary member of their body, and in
doing so they would beg to offer their heartfelt wishes for
your continued health and happiness.
body.closer:
“By order of the committee,
“JULIUS LE SOUEF, Secretary.“The Baron von Humboldt, &c.”

div.p: Baron von Humboldt returned the following answer :—

body.p:
“Monsieur,—Dans la vie agiteé que nous menons pendant
le trop court sejour de mon Souverain en Angleterre, il ne me
reste que le regret de ne pas avoir un moment de libre pour
exprimer personellement au comité de l’illustre ‘Colonial
Society’ la vive reconnaissance dont je me sens pénétré. Je
vous supplie, Monsieur, de vouloir bien être l’interpréte de
mes sentimens respectueux. Rien ne pourrait être plus flat-
teur pour moi que l’intérét que mes faibles efforts ont pu
inspirer à une réunion dont les travaux tendent à un but si
noble et si bienfaisant pour l’humanité.
body.closer:
“Agréez, Monsieur, je vous supplie, l’homage de la haute
considération avec laquelle j’ai l’honneur d’être, Monsieur,
votre très humble et très obéissant serviteur, “Le Baron von HUMBOLDT. “M. Julius Le Souef, &c.”
